result.execSummary:
The defendant Lucas J. Hillsberg was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manuf/Deliver Schedule I, II Narcotics, a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

  Report on or before January 28, 2017 by 7:00pm, clean & sober.

records.addlTxt: Marquette County DNA Proof of Submission

Defendant Lucas J. Hillsberg in court with attorney Brian William Severson.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
14CF75 & 14CM154 tracking together:
  Atty Hendee states plea agreement to Ct. 1 in 14CF75.  14CM154 to be dismissed.  Atty Severson agrees and enters a Guilty plea.  Defendant agrees.
  Court questions defendant regarding plea. Advises of Constitutional Rights and elements of the charge.  Court finds plea made knowingly, voluntarily & Intelligently.  Court relies on the criminal complaint for a factual basis.  

BY THE COURT:  Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.  Court accepts defendant's plea and finds defendant guilty of Ct. 1 in 14CF75.  14CM154 to be dismissed.

Atty Hendee states that parties are not requesting a PSI to be ordered.  Atty Hendee asks the court to follow the joint recommendation.
Atty Severson makes sentencing arguments.  Atty Severson states the three start dates of the jail time.

BY THE COURT:  14CF75, Ct. 1:  Withhold Sentence; 36 months Probation with conditions:
75 days in the Marquette County Jail; conditional time
Sentence may be served in three 25 day segments with start dates as follows:
  Report on or before September 28, 2016 by 7:00pm, clean & sober.
  Report on or before November 28, 2016 by 7:00pm, clean & sober.
  Report on or before January 28, 2017 by 7:00pm, clean & sober.
Court Costs = $268.00
  DNA Sample + $250.00 Surcharge

15CM154 to be dismissed.

Defendant Lucas J. Hillsberg in court with attorney Mark Jay Gumz.  Tania Marie Bonnett appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
14CM154 tracking with:
  Atty Gumz states that the defendant will waive the Prelim today and has discussed the waiver with his client.  Court questions the defendant.  Defendant agrees with the waiver.  Court accepts the waiver of the Prelim.

  BY THE COURT:  Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and this defendant committed it.  Case bound over for trial or further proceedings.

BY THE COURT:  Set for Arraignment.
bond contined.  Arraignment scheduled for June 4, 2015 at 10:30 am.
Preliminary hearing at 04-23-2015 10:00 am

Defendant Lucas J. Hillsberg in court with attorney Mark Jay Gumz.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
14CF75 & 14CM154:
Atty Hendee states that the matters are set for review for competency and all parties have received the evaluation.  Atty Hendee asks that the court find that the defendant is competent to proceed.  
Court received an evaluation report in January.  Atty Gumz received the report and has reviewed it with his client.  Atty Gumz has concerns with the report.  

BY THE COURT:  Court finds that the defendant is competent to proceed.
Set for Prelim on 14CF75; 14CM154 will continue to track.
bond continued.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 23, 2015 at 10:00 am.
Review hearing on March 19, 2015 at 11:30 am.

Defendant Lucas J. Hillsberg in court with attorney Mark Jay Gumz.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
14CF75 & 14CM154:
Atty Hendee states that all parties have received Dr. Schoenecker's report.  Atty Hendee states that the Dr. did not have enough information at this time to make an assessment that the defendant would become competent or not.  Court questions counsel.  Atty Gumz states that the defendant has reviewed the report and asks the court to find the defendant not competent at this time and asks the court to order another evaluation from another Dr.
Atty Hendee responds and asks that the court order in-patient so Dr. Schoenecker can finish his evaluation as per the request of the Dr.
Atty Gumz responds.

BY THE COURT: Court finds the defendant not competent to proceed.
Court will order in-patient for the defendant for an assessment to be done by Dr. Schoenecker regarding if the defendant will regain competency; defendant is to report to in-patient within 30 days.
Set for Review.
Court will prepare the Order.
Court denies the request for another evaluation to be done from a different Dr.
bond continued.
  Review hearing scheduled for March 19, 2015 at 11:30 am.
Competency hearing on December 19, 2014 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Lucas J. Hillsberg in court with attorney Mark J. Gumz.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint & waives it's reading.  Atty Gumz questions defendants competency and requests an examination be done.  Does stipulate at this time that there is probable cause.  BY THE COURT:  Court also finds probable cause and will order a competency examination.  
Atty Hendee requests signature bond with conditions.  BY THE COURT:  Court sets $500 signature bond with conditions:  *Appear for booking.
Atty Hendee requests the Court appoint an examiner who has not worked with this defendant.  Atty Gumz objects.  BY THE COURT:  Court will take under advisement and notify parties by end of day today.  Competency hearing scheduled for December 18, 2014 at 11:00 am.
